w:r.w:t: This paper outlines the online PR campaign of Breadfast Pay, taking the original grocery app feature and turning it into a comprehensive family payment ecosystem wallet. In response to the current economic climate, where Egyptians are suffering from high inflation, Egyptian households are scrutinizing luxury spending.

The proposed strategy, "One Wallet, Two Lifestyles," leverages a dual-persona approach, targeting moms (the household financial controllers) and Gen Z, with a lifestyle-focused approach targeting children, adults, and adults alike. Unifying grocery spending and lifestyle spending with a selective focus on coffee, Breadfast Pay aims to achieve 400 active family accounts and 1 million EGP in wallet load within a 14-day launch sprint campaign.
The campaign utilizes a PESO model: Paid, Earn, Shared, Owned, with distinct contact tracks for each demographic supported by a thorough measurement plan based on the AMEC framework.

The Egyptian market is currently strained by increasing inflation, with households having to prioritize essential spending over items that they do not need, even if they want them. has historically been perceived as a premium grocery service, which poses a risk in a cost-conscious environment across the board, no matter the socio-economic class. Furthermore, there are many competitors in the fintech payment business, therefore,
needs to position itself in its own quadrant of the market in order to not fall into a “red ocean" and get eaten up by big shots like Fawry, Instapay and Telda (Internal Brief, 2025).

Families are cutting luxuries out of their lives, such as coffee—especially daily specialty coffee—replacing it with sachet over-the-counter coffee in order to manage rising household costs. This behavior threatens the main use case of
Pay, which is a lifestyle application, if they are only seen as consumption engines and not as management tools for the household.
Turning the situation and challenge into an opportunity is pivotal for the success of

Pay. This involves a strategic pivot to position it as both a spending mechanism and a budget management tool, i.e. “the family wallet”. Connecting the grocery budget, which is managed by the parents, and the lifestyle allowance, which is used and craved by Gen Z,
Pay can become the central financial hub for the entire house (Fintech News Africa, 2024).
A quadrant analysis of the Egyptian fintech market reveals a "Sweet Spot" at the intersection of
Uniquely positioned in the Family + Lifestyle quadrant.
Strong on "Lifestyle" and "Individual" appeal (Gen Z focus) but lack the household utility anchor.
Dominant in "Utility" but lack the aspirational "Lifestyle" brand equity.
Attempts the family angle but lacks the high-frequency ecosystem (Groceries + Coffee) that
• Persona: “Maya, 28-32, Urban Advertising / BTL (Below The Line), main household decision-maker, working mom
• Behaviour: manages the daily spending of the family such as, school needs, groceries, transport, while aiming to remain budget-aware and digitally fluent.
• Barrier: Does not trust financial tools that feel complicated and unfamiliar to the market. Suspicious of apps that promise savings, but do not deliver immediate value.
• Insight: Constantly prioritizing her family’s needs, she seeks a clear financial solution that provides immediate value and a sense of control, without the hassle of mental effort.
• Persona: “Ziad, 18-23, Urban University Student / Fresh Graduate, secondary household spender, tech-native.
• Behaviour: consumes daily specialty coffee, transportation, and outings, while aiming to maximize social experiences but also has a limited allowance or salary.

• Barrier: Dismisses financial tools that are old and "boring" to operate like traditional banking apps. He is suspicious of budgeting apps that restrict freedom without instant gratification or gamified rewards.

• Insight: He is looking for a seamless payment integration that justifies his lifestyle choices through 'hacks' like cashback in an effortless way. He is constantly prioritizing social relevance and convenience.
Reach 160,000 unique households across TikTok and Instagram promoting
pay, achieving at least 1.9% CTR within 14 days.
Generate at least 400 application sign-ups and cashback within 14 days, with a landing-page conversion rate of 5%.
Social media content: posts, reels, landing page, and app tutorial snippets.
Pay, shift in sentiment to be positive by 70% ("Breadfast helps me save money")
Increase in app downloads, registrations, and engagement with the app features.
Highlighting tangible and instant rewards on daily spending , positioning household expenses as a beneficial and rewarding experience.
“Get cash back from what you already buy.”
A fast, easy, and secure app for household spending.
Dependable, savvy, and simple; CTA: “Sign up today and make every purchase count.”
Instagram & TikTok ads, short videos highlighting (Convenience/ Ease ) & (Rewards / Cashbacks
PR to parent and lifestyle creators, and application reviews
Social proof and boosts community engagement

Pay benefits, FAQs, and cashback tutorial

100k-500k followers, focus on everyday lifestyle, parenting, authentic and relevant content.
Brand safety checked: (positive reputations, applicable audience class)
Egypt-based mothers and lifestyle macro-influencers @Daliaragheb_ , @Sarahhanyy, and @Nourhan3mad_

Pay helps individuals and families save and earn while buying groceries, coffee, or school supplies. Create content to guide people through registering and cashback rewards. Include a clear and simple CTA to download the app.
2-4 stories + 1 reel each, whitelisting for spark ads; 14‑day usage rights in paid/social
1 high‑quality TikTok showing the full cashback moment

Our goal is to create a high-speed landing page that is optimized for mobile and desktop that explains the family wallet concept and convinces users to download the app and register immediately with appropriate tracking to see who is signing up.
We are using a flow that is streamlined in order to bridge the gap between the moms and Gen Z in a format for the landing page that works for both demographics.
USP (One Wallet, Two Lifestyles) + Visual Hook (Split screen: Groceries/Coffee).
Influencer testimonials (Moms & Gen Z creators) to build trust.
A 3-step breakdown of how the shared wallet works.
Direct Deep Link to Download App or "Claim Cashback" button.
Our objective is to capture new account sign-ups/leads and drive the first wallet load, which is a conversion.
"I control the budget, he gets his coffee." –
Mom Loads Wallet → Teen Spends → Both Earn Rewards.
We will be tracking the landing page using Google Analytics 4 and Firebase in order to ensure that the moms and Gen Z demographics are clicking the links, and who is clicking said links.
Since this is a family product used in Egypt, we use a WhatsApp link for the user to easily send a request to their parents to sign up.
This link is formatted for the use case of Gen Z sending the link to mom to sign up for the wallet.
"Mom check this out we can get cashback on groceries and my coffee"
Reply and interact with the audience quickly, handle clients' questions and concerns.
Reply within an hour, from 10 AM to 10 PM (Africa/Cairo time).
How to use it for groceries/orders?
(double charge, failed payment): resort to support centre within an hour
: Reply with correction and contact the marketing team if complaints are high.
Brand mentions (Breadfast, Breadfast Pay, Breadfast App)
Tracking the top, middle, and bottom of the funnel to see if the family ecosystem positioning for

Pay is functional and captivating for the target audience of moms and Gen Z. Based on this, we are going to decide if we need to pivot the content styles associated with each target demographic (Bethel University, 2014).
Reach ≥ 160,000 households (across TikTok & IG), video completion ≥ 20% on reels, CTR ≥ 1.9% (aiming higher than standard).
We need to get our videos in front of at least 160,000 families and make sure the content is interesting enough that they do not scroll past immediately.
Engagement rate (ER) ≥ 4%, sentiment ≥ 70% positive (shifting perception from "expensive grocery app" to "helpful wallet"), high volume of saves on the "Financial Parenting" guides.
We want people to stop seeing us as "just another expensive app" and start trusting us as a helpful tool, proved by them liking, commenting, and saving our guides.
New Account Sign-ups (Leads) ≥ 400, LP conversion rate (CVR) ≥ 5%, Total Wallet Load ≥ EGP 1,000,000 (sprint goal).
This is where leads actually turn into conversions. We need 400 people to actually sign up and trust us enough to deposit money into the wallet.
Test hooks (Efficiency/Control for Moms vs. Lifestyle/Rewards for Gen Z)
Test Macro-Influencers (Dalia/Sarah) vs. Spark Ads performance.

We are running an experiment to see if the targeting is working through the control and safety messages for moms or if the lifestyle and work messages are working well for Gen Z, so we know who to target next time.
EGP 200,000 (Allocated for a 14-day launch sprint campaign).
Reach 160k households and promote creator posts (Spark Ads)
1 Reel + 3 Stories each; includes usage rights and whitelisting
Cashback subsidies and prizes to drive app adoption/UGC
Landing page assets, creative props, and editing
Any influencer that was paid, must include #ad in the content they are publishing, or clearly announce it.
: Before reposting content, permission from the users must be acquired.

All content shared must include inclusive language and visuals in order to prevent any legal claims. In addition, the messages should be accurate when it comes to the cashback percentages and benefits.

Any AI-generated content (videos, photos, copies) must be revised and approved by a human member and all facts and claims must be re-checked. Additionally, when posting it must include that this is an AI content for authenticity.
FAQS will be provided to answer
includes refunds and support centers in case of issues or user complaints.
